data.description: Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility. We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience. Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you. Team Description: The Cell team tests and develops battery cells to analyze their electrochemical performance, integrating insights gained to refine and transfer cell parameters into vehicle-level specifications. Role/Responsibilities: As a summer intern on the Cell engineering team, you’ll work on the following: Analyze lithium-ion cell degradation behavior using electrochemical data and advanced data analysis tools (e.g., Python, MATLAB, JMP). Perform in-depth interpretation of cell aging data, leveraging advanced electrochemical methodologies and analysis techniques. Identify correlations between degradation patterns, cell chemistry, and test conditions. Design and conduct accelerated aging experiments to validate degradation hypotheses. Utilize existing aging data to predict cell energy under varying aging conditions. Preferred Qualifications: Field of study: Chemistry, Material Science, Chemical Engineering, or related field In Master’s or PhD’s Degree Program, more than 1 year experience in lithium-ion battery field Strong background in lithium-ion batteries and electrochemistry Proficient in electrochemical testing, data analysis, and scripting (e.g., Python, MATLAB) Experienced in processing large batches of data using self-developed scripts Experience with experimental design and statistical analysis Excellent problem-solving and communication skills Nice to Have: Experienced in post-mortem analysis on aged cells Skilled in cell aging modeling and energy prediction More than 3 years of experience in lithium-ion battery field Education: Field(s) of study: Chemistry, Material Science, Chemical Engineering or related field Currently enrolled in a Master’s or PhD Degree program at an accredited university. Proof of enrollment in current or into next program (MS or PhD). Program Information: Timing: May- August, or June-September pending class schedules. Duration of Internship: Our internship program is 12 weeks; the end date is flexible based on individual needs. Work Location & Environment: This position will be in Newark, CA, and is fully in-person. You must be prepared to start onsite for your first day of employment. The working environment will be a mix of lab & office work. Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable ranging from $43 to $63 (subject to changes). Relocation: May be provided on a case to case basis. Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area. Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check. Drug Screening: All offers of employment are contingent on passing a drug screen. Medical benefits: Dental, vision, and medical on day 1 for all interns working full-time. Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S employment authorization.
